channel.title: The AI Pravda
channel.description: Generative AI will change the world as we know it. Let's get prepared.

item.title: Yabebal Fantaye: AI must work for you - impact on software education
item.description: Discussion on AI's transformative impact on software education and development practices, featuring insights from Yabebal Fantaye on how developers and educators can harness AI tools effectively.

item.title: Y Combinator's love for generative AI
item.description: Analysis of Y Combinator's investment trends and enthusiasm for generative AI startups, exploring how the prestigious accelerator is shaping the future of AI entrepreneurship.

item.title: Window into the mind of AI
item.description: Exploring the inner workings and decision-making processes of artificial intelligence systems, providing insights into how AI models process information and make decisions.

item.title: When AGI gets too smart
item.description: Examining the potential challenges and implications of artificial general intelligence surpassing human capabilities, and what safeguards we need to implement.

item.title: What photo, who human, which company?
item.description: Investigating the blurred lines between AI-generated and human-created content in the digital age, and the implications for authenticity and trust.

item.title: We're dealing with something unbelievably transformative and powerful
item.description: Reflections on the unprecedented scale and impact of current AI developments, and why we need to take the AI revolution seriously.

item.title: War and peace in the AI era
item.description: Examining how artificial intelligence is reshaping global conflicts and peacekeeping efforts, and the geopolitical implications of AI advancement.

item.title: US-Israel tech relations under Trump 2
item.description: Analysis of technology partnerships and diplomatic relations between the US and Israel during the second Trump administration.

item.title: Toward universal AI literacy
item.description: Advocating for widespread AI education and digital literacy initiatives to prepare society for the AI-driven future.

item.title: Stephen Fry on AI
item.description: Insights and perspectives from Stephen Fry on artificial intelligence and its cultural impact, exploring the intersection of technology and humanity.

item.title: AI sovereignty
item.description: Exploring national strategies for maintaining independence and control in the AI landscape, and the importance of technological sovereignty.

item.title: The soul of Claude
item.description: Deep dive into the personality and capabilities of Anthropic's Claude AI assistant, exploring what makes different AI models unique.

item.title: Software development trends 2025
item.description: Comprehensive overview of emerging trends and technologies in software development, including AI-assisted coding and new frameworks.

item.title: Seven popular misconceptions about AI in education
item.description: Debunking common myths and misunderstandings about AI's role in educational settings, providing clarity for educators and policymakers.

item.title: Schmidt Science supports AI safety research
item.description: Coverage of philanthropic efforts to advance AI safety and responsible development through the Schmidt Science Fellows program.

item.title: Scaling laws meet hunger for clickbait
item.description: Critical analysis of how AI scaling laws are portrayed in popular media and the disconnect between research and reporting.

item.title: Responsible AI: from theory to practice
item.description: Practical approaches to implementing responsible AI principles in real-world applications and organizational contexts.

item.title: Preventing AI apocalypse
item.description: Strategies and safeguards for mitigating existential risks from artificial intelligence development and deployment.

item.title: Peter Lee: AI learning from nature
item.description: Exploring biomimetic approaches to artificial intelligence development with insights from Microsoft's Peter Lee.

item.title: Papert's revenge: AI revolution in education
item.description: How AI is finally fulfilling Seymour Papert's vision of constructionist learning and transforming educational paradigms.

item.title: Our AI friends, confidants, and profiteers
item.description: Examining the complex relationships humans are developing with AI systems and the business models emerging around AI companionship.

item.title: AI Safety Report 2025
item.description: The International AI Safety Report 2025 was published in January 2025 as the first full edition following an interim version released in May 2024. Comprehensive analysis of AI capabilities, risks, and risk management strategies.

item.title: AI Revolution: students get it, institutions don't. And what does it mean for Ethiopia?
item.description: In 2017 Andrew Ng from Stanford AI Lab said: "AI is the new electricity. Just as electricity transformed almost everything 100 years ago,â€¦ every industry will transform in the next several years." Analysis of how students are embracing AI while institutions lag behind.

item.title: AI specimen: from hype to harmony
item.description: The term "AI agent" often creates a false framework that misrepresents the nature of artificial intelligence. Introducing the concept of "AI specimens" as a better framework for understanding agentic AI systems.
